reviews.review_text:
A Hidden Gem in Goa
If you're looking for a hidden gem in Goa, then Cafe Chocolatti is the perfect place for you. This cozy cafe is tucked away in a quiet corner of Candolim and is the perfect place to escape the hustle and bustle of the beach.

The cafe is decorated in a rustic style, with exposed brick walls and wooden tables and chairs. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, making it the perfect place to relax and enjoy a cup of coffee or a delicious meal.

The menu at Cafe Chocolatti is extensive and features a wide variety of dishes, from breakfast to dinner. The breakfast menu includes pancakes, waffles, eggs, and toast. The lunch and dinner menu features a variety of pastas, pizzas, salads, and sandwiches. There is also a wide selection of desserts, including cakes, pies, and ice cream.

The food at Cafe Chocolatti is delicious and reasonably priced. The service is also excellent, and the staff is friendly and attentive.

Overall, Cafe Chocolatti is a great place to visit if you're looking for a delicious meal and a relaxing atmosphere. It is a hidden gem in Goa that is definitely worth checking out.

Here are some of the highlights of Cafe Chocolatti:
* The cozy and inviting atmosphere.
* The delicious food.
* The friendly and attentive staff.
* The reasonable prices.
I highly recommend Cafe Chocolatti to anyone looking for a great dining experience in Goa.

One problem is parking not available.

Another gem in Candolim Goa. We came for breakfast and ordered English breakfast, Eggs Benedict and coffees.
The sausage, ham and bacon were fresh and great to taste.
The hollandaise sauce was done very well. The sunny side up was just perfect and had an oozy yolk.
The organic marzipan orange was awesome!
Service is great. Ambience is great. If you like continental foods, this is the place to come for that great fresh taste!
Overall superb! üëç

Located on a busy road, Cafe Chocolatti is a quaint place to have a peaceful meal, catch up with friends or even work.

They have a beautiful ambiance with ample space along with a designated space from smoking.

They serve some delicious wholesome meals. We tried their classic english breakfast which was a 5/5.

A burger and smoked chicken pannini each of which was equally wholesome, balanced and delicious. So another 5/5

Their fresh scones with homemade spread and cream is bound to take you to those english novel eras. That cannot be missed.

It's also one of the few cafes that clearly mentions allergies and talking to the staff before ordering. Grateful for that.

Lastly, don't forget to peek into their dessert section. They make some delicious desserts and many of which are gluten free too.

Overall, it's a must visit place and I'm looking forward forward to visiting it again
